attribs.name: damage_resistances
attribs.current: cold, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from non magical weapons

attribs.name: repeating_action_-KKWZGjedD63VXQHuCj9_content
attribs.current: The creature takes (2) attacks every round.

attribs.name: repeating_action_-KKWZkqB5gIMIUwVgHih_content
attribs.current: One attack maybe used against a target of creature's size or smaller within 5ft of the creature must make a Dexterity Saving throw or be grappled (escape DC 17). Until Grapple ends, the target is restrained - the Hoard golem will normally then make attempts to take the most valuable item(s) from its target and detach. Once it has gained 4 items - it flees.

attribs.name: repeating_action_-KKWZLxuJA2iA4ZSpEbH_content
attribs.current: The creature takes a grappled creature  and throws them 30ft away. Any creature that is in that line must make a save or take the bludgeoning damage

attribs.name: repeating_trait_-KKWWwRLTiZINSrJq7jp_content
attribs.current: The creature cannot be polymorphed or its form changed.

attribs.name: repeating_trait_-KKWXGKSq4-RyfU20AZp_content
attribs.current: The creature's attacks count as magic weapons.

attribs.name: repeating_action_-KKWZLxuJA2iA4ZSpEbH_other_damage_string
attribs.current: 7 (2d6) bludgeoning (being hit) damage plus 28 (8d6) bludgeoning (thrown) damage.

attribs.name: repeating_trait_-KqmwDMf-0eBqgA4BEQq_content
attribs.current: There is a 50% chance any item found in a hoard golem’s treasure has the broken condition if the creature is defeated.

attribs.name: repeating_action_-Kqmxt2gwMWDdrwAWMoN_content
attribs.current: A hoard golem assimilates the valuables of creatures caught in its whirlwind. Every round a hoard golem spends in its whirlwind form, it attempts one disarm combat maneuver as a free action against any creature caught in its whirlwind. If successful, it removes the most valuable item of its opponent - not necessarily a carried item.

attribs.name: repeating_trait_-KqmyH6dBoC98K8TXFR7_content
attribs.current:
As an action the Hoard Golem can shift between its three forms:

Wave: Immune to bludgeoning - it flattens itself and cannot be grappled, has advantage on stealth checks.
Humanoid: (normal)
Whirlwind: immune to slashing - it gathers its pieces up and seeks to gather in more

attribs.name: miscellaneous_notes
attribs.current: Hoard golems were born from the paranoia of dragons. Despite their great physical and intellectual power, dragons can’t help being suspicious of the mercenary motives of any creature willing to work for them. The first hoard golem was created when a dragon realized that there could be no guardian more trustworthy with its hoard than the hoard itself. Since then, the secret of hoard golem construction has emerged, and rich nobles have followed suit, enchanting their wealth to defend itself from thieves. As constructs, hoard golems are mindless, lying in wait for anyone other than their creator to come within striking distance. In the case of evil dragons, this sometimes includes the wyrmlings of dragon parents looking to establish dominance in the family. Hoard golems will fight to the death, but they are instructed not to leave the rooms they inhabit for fear that clever treasure hunters might trick the hoard into taking itself right out of the owner’s den.  Hoard golems cannot speak. A hoard golem is 25 ft. tall and weighs 20,000 lb.
